Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater: interior black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of a satyr (lower body and tail with added white, and left hand remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 48, pl. XXVII, no. 5)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 496, no. C34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1172)
